0.name: no_risk
0.description: No major environmental or physiological imbalance detected.
remedies: Maintain regular irrigation and farm hygiene
Continue balanced fertilization schedule
Monitor environmental conditions weekly

1.name: fungal
1.description: High humidity / cloud cover risk leading to fungal growth.
remedies: Reduce irrigation and improve soil aeration
Apply white mustard paste at root zone
Drench with sesame + ash mixture (Vrikshayurveda)
Remove wet soil and replace with dry soil
Provide morning sunlight exposure

2.name: microbial
2.description: Warm + humid conditions may lead to microbial soft rot or infections.
remedies: Apply Panchamula decoction as soil drench
Use Kunapa water to improve root immunity
Improve drainage and avoid water accumulation
Remove infected plant debris immediately

3.name: viral
3.description: High temperature + humidity + low wind increases viral spread risk.
remedies: Water with mixture of milk + honey + yastimadhu + madhuka decoction
Apply Triphala + ghee + honey soil treatment
Provide shade nets during extreme heat
Control insect vectors (aphids, whiteflies)

4.name: insect
4.description: Warm + moderate humid conditions favour insect infestation.
remedies: Use neem-based extract spray
Smoke field with mustard + vidanga + vacha + usana mixture
Apply root paste: white mustard + vacha + kusta + ativisha
Sprinkle ash + fine soil to deter caterpillars
Use cold-water drenching for 7 days to remove root insects

5.name: vata
5.description: Dry, cool and windy conditions causing Vata imbalance in plants.
remedies: Apply Kunapa water regularly for moisture balance
Use organic mulching to retain soil moisture
Spray Panchamula decoction
Apply fermented mixture (hog fat + oils) described in Vrikshayurveda for severe Vata imbalance
Reduce wind exposure using natural barriers
